thread.title: At 106, meet the world’s oldest cougar
thread.title_full: At 106, meet the world’s oldest cougar

title: At 106, meet the world’s oldest cougar
text:
Valdemira Rodrigues de Oliveira, 106, becomes engaged at to a man 40 years her junior February 6, 2017 7:45pm 106-year-old Valdemira Rodriguez had become the oldest person to get engaged, seen kissing her partner Aparecido Dias Jacob, aged 66. Picture: Janet Tappin Coelho/Caters News Agency Hannah Crouch The Sun Share on Twitter 
A BRAZILIAN pensioner has become the oldest person to get engaged at 106 years old. 
Valdemira Rodrigues de Oliveira said yes to her 66-year-old toyboy Aparecido Dias Jacob in a stunning betrothal ceremony on Saturday, The Sun reports . 
The pair of smitten seniors, with the combined age of 172 years, held the special engagement after doctors had banned their marriage. 
Medics assessed their health and age and warned the duo, known affectionately as Valda and Jaco, would not be able to cope living on their own. 
But after three years together, the elderly romantics, who have separate rooms at Nossa Senhora Fatima retirement home in Pirassununga, south east Brazil, were determined to prove it’s never too late to be with your soulmate. Valda walks down the aisle to greet her love, Jaco. Picture: Caters News Agency Source: Caters News Agency 
The elderly sweethearts exchanged engagement rings in a betrothal service organised by volunteers under an initiative called the “Project of Dreams”. 
The event was lavishly decorated with a four-tier cake, flowers, cupid ornaments and scattered rose petals. 
Valda wore a white dress with a fancy in her hair, pearls around her neck, nails painted and comfortable slippers. 
She walked down the aisle with her Zimmer-frame decorated with roses. 
Speaking about her love for her future husband, the centenarian said: “I fell in love with him. I like him a lot. If he died, I die too.” 
The love-struck pair met at the residential home in 2014 and it was love at first sight for Jaco, who suffers from paralysis of the left arm. 
He has been living in the home for 19 years after being homeless and unemployed. Jaco waits for his fiancee. Picture: Caters News Agency Source: Caters News Agency 
Jaco said of his 106-year-old love: “I fell in love with Valda from the moment I saw her. I know she’s a little older than me, but that doesn’t matter because she makes me really happy. 
“I asked her to marry me and we always believed it would happen but getting engaged is a step forward for us right now.” 
The couple are inseparable and spend all day with each other, chatting and eating their meals together and sitting side-by-side in the home. The happy couple seal their engagement celebration with a kiss. Picture: Janet Tappin Coelho/Caters News Agency Source: Caters News Agency 
Both Valda and Jaco have not been married before. 
Neither of them have children and most of Valda’s relatives have died while Jaco has lost touch with his family. 
A volunteer page boy and bridesmaid, Renan and Isabetter, both 12-years-old, accompanied Valda. 
A live band played the wedding march as Jaco, dressed in a bespoke suit and tie, waited at the front with the master of ceremonies for his future fiancee. The aisle was decorated with rose petals. Picture: Janet Tappin Coelho/Caters News Agency Source: Caters News Agency 
At the alter, the couple couldn’t hold back from sealing the occasion with a passionate kiss before taking their vows in front of 150 invited guests. 
After a short message and prayer, the happy couple said “yes” to stay loyal to each other and exchanged engagement rings. 
This article was reproduced with permission from The Sun .
